questionnaireInfo.text:
This demo shows the main capabilities of ExpressionManager, including:
Dynamic tailoring of question text, including real-time Assessments.  This includes access to a dozen question attributes so that you can show print-answer-like reports mid-survey
Dynamic control of question visibility via Relevance - like dynamic, complex Conditions
Flagging irrelevant questions as Not Applicable (they get NULLed in the database)
Cascading relevance - since irrelevant questions have their responses blanked out, relevance conditions can be cascaded by checking whether any single predecessor has a valid response.
Refer to questions by the SPSS/R variable_label (title/code) or via SGQA code
Navigation Index that lets you jump backwards, change answers, then safely jump forwards again (it will re-compute and  validate everything in between)
Default Values (group All Question Types) - Note that if questions with default values become irrelevant, are saved, then become relevant again, the default values are restored
Enhanced development and debugging tools - e.g. from admin mode, select 'Survey Logic File' to see one-page view of all question/subquestion/answer text, conditions, attributes, relevance, validation, and tailoring; and click on any variable name to open a new window to edit that question or group.
<p>
Please be sure to change your answers on the page, and navigate back and forth to see how it changes which questions you see and what they say.</p>

sectionInfo.text: Dynamic, On-page Report Generation
After saying where you live, watch how your answers dynamically change the reports at the bottom of the page.

Here is a double-check that INSERTANS:xxx works as expected.


				Var
			
				SGQA
			
				INSERTANS:SGQA
		
				city
			
				82556X10X104
			
				82556X10X104, INSERTANS:82556X10X104
		
				yearsThere
			
				82556X10X105
			
				82556X10X105, INSERTANS:82556X10X105
		
				ranking_2
			
				82556X10X1062
			
				82556X10X1062, INSERTANS:82556X10X1062
		
				opinions_srv
			
				82556X10X107srv
			
				82556X10X107srv, INSERTANS:82556X10X107srv
		
				worries_smog_0
			
				82556X10X108smog#0
			
				82556X10X108smog#0, INSERTANS:82556X10X108smog#0
		
				worries_trans_1
			
				82556X10X108trans#1
			
				82556X10X108trans#1, INSERTANS:82556X10X108trans#1

	 </p>

sectionInfo.text: Dynamic Math Display

Shows the syntax of all of the currently available math function.  Change the values for num and num2 to show how its results change.
Please make sure that <b>num</b> is less than <b>num2</b>, otherwise you won't be able to answer some of the validation tests.
Also, in order to see the Dynamic Relevance page, the value for <b>num</b> must be greater than 10.

FunctionSyntaxResultAbsolute valueabs()Arc cosineacos()Arc sineasin()Arc tangent of two variablesatan2(,)Arc tangentatan()Round fractions upceil()Cosinecos()Calculates the exponent of eexp()Round fractions downfloor()Finds whether a value is not a numberis_nan()Natural logarithmlog()Get value of pipi()3.1415926535898Exponential expressionpow(,)Generate a random integerrand()929865660Rounds a floatround()Sinesin()Square rootsqrt()Calculate the sum of values in an arraysum()Tangenttan()Find lowest valuemin(,,+,-,*,/2)Find highest valuemax(,,+,-,*,/2)Sumsum(,,+,-,*,/2)Join array elements with a stringimplode('~',,,+,-,*,/2)~~~NAN~NAN~NANGet the integer value of a variableintval()Finds whether the type of a variable is floatis_float()Finds whether the type of a variable is integeris_int()Finds whether the type of a variable is NULLis_null()Finds whether a variable is a number or a numeric stringis_numeric()Finds whether the type of a variable is stringis_string()1Determine whether a variable is considered to be emptyis_empty()1
Please make sure that  the first number (<b>num</b>) is less than the second number (<b>num2</b>), otherwise you will not be able to answer some of the validation tests.

Since <b>num</b> is less than 10, you will not be able to see the Dynamic Relevance page; and since that page asks your age, you will not be able to complete the validation questions later in the survey, that depend upon your age.
Dynamic Relevance

Shows how Relevance can be change question visibility (e.g. dynamic branching).
This page is only shown when <b>num</b> from the previous page is greater than 10.  It's current value is {num}.
You must enter values for <b>age</b> and <b>yearsMarried</b> in order to complete some of the Validation Tests later in this survey; and <b>age</b> must be greater than <b>yearsMarried</b>.
Please enter some information about yourselfif(is_empty(name), '', if(is_empty(age), 'How old are you?', implode(' ', 'So, you are', age, 'years old.  Funny, you don'tlookit. ' )))

You must enter values for <b>age</b> and <b>yearsMarried</b> in order to complete some of the Validation Tests later in the survey.
In order to enter age, you must enter your name.  In order to enter yearsMarried, you must say you are more than 5 years old.

You say that you are  years old,  but that you have been married for   years.  Sorry, past lives don't count.
Please correct this or you won't be able to pass some of the Validation Tests later in this survey.

sectionInfo.text: All Question Types
Collect some data from all question types so can validate ExpressionManager's ability to work with it.  Note that all question types that support default values have a default value set.
<p>This is just a text display.  Is the rendered value saved anywhere?  Is there a database field for it (e.g. to emulate the Equation question type)?</p>

sectionInfo.text: Summary Page
This shows a summary of the responses given
Array Filter Tests
This tests each of the array filter types

question.text: [M] All the other questions will filter on this one

sectionInfo.text: Array Filter Exclusion Tests
This tests each of the array filter exclusion types
Validation Tests
These validations use dynamically generated min/max values whenever possible.

directive.text: The  sum of the values must be between <b>num</b> and <b>num2</b> from the Dynamic Math Display page.  So, base on current values, the sum must be between  {num} and {num2}
The sum of the values must equal <b>num</b> from the Dynamic Math Display page, so based on current values, the sum must equal {num}

sectionInfo.text: Validation Tests - with Regular Expression Masks
This tests that EM can create appropriate validation equations for question types that use built-in validation.  Most of these questions use regular expression masks

directive.text: The sum of the values must be between <b>num</b> and <b>num2</b> from the Dynamic Math display page, so based on current values, between {num} and {num2}.
Entries must be 1-99, or 888 (refused) or 999 (unknown)  AND, the sum must equal {num} (<b>num</b> from the Dynamic Math Display page.)
Numbers must be between 0 and 99 (and also between <b>yearsMarried</b> and <b>age</b> (both from the Dynamic Relevance page), so based on current values, between {yearsMarried} and {age})

question.text: How much US money do you have in your pocket?
